educations.schoolName: Loyola University New Orleans College of Law

headline: Assistant Chief Counsel at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

positions.description: A judicial law clerk at the New Orleans Immigration Court for the Executive Office for Immigration Review. Through the position in the Attorney General's Honor Program, I collaborated with at least two judges regularly to help research and write their opinions. Wrote legal memoranda as well as opinions for written decision. Issues ranged from asylum law involving particularized social groups, criminal bars to immigration relief, motions to suppress in the immigration context, cancellation of removal applications, to adjustment of status and the Child Protection Status Act. I also managed the Federal Internship Program at the New Orleans Immigration Court for law students seeking summer or semester judicial clerkships with the Court.
positions.title: Judicial Law Clerk

positions.companyName: Loyola University New Orleans College of Law
positions.description: Collaborated with and conducted research for Professor Johanna Kalb at Loyola University New Orleans College of Law. Researched her hypotheses while also revising and checking past research on pieces she already written and submitted for publication. I worked with her on a range of issues but most dealt with international law or treaties and how they affect or shape the judiciary here in the United States.
positions.title: Research Assistant

positions.companyName: Stuart H. Smith Law Clinic & Center for Social Justice
positions.description: Consulted and conducted immigration client casework under direct supervision of clinical and staff attorneys. Took the lead on over five cases by conducting client interviews, drafting declarations and affidavits, drafting and submitting legal memorandums and applications. Participated in I.C.E. detention center Know Your Rights Campaigns. Organized and attended a forum of cooperation for U-Visa promotion with the Hattiesburg, Mississippi Police Department. Collected all evidence, documents, declarations, expert testimony, and country condition research for an asylum application while also conducting numerous client interviews and writing the memorandum of law, completing, and sending the finished application for USCIS adjudication.  Researched and prepared a motion to suppress for removal proceedings.
positions.title: Student Practitioner

positions.companyName: Galloway, Johnson, Tompkins, Burr & Smith, A PLC
positions.title: Summer Associate

positions.companyName: Loyola University New Orleans College of Law
positions.description: As a Writing Lab T.A. I aided first year law students prepare their memorandums and other writing assignments for their Legal Research and Writing class. I worked with them on structure, legal analytical skills, writing style, and citation format.
positions.title: Writing Lab Teaching Assistant

positions.companyName: Loyola University New Orleans College of Law
positions.description: Research Assistant for Clinical Professor Hiroko Kusuda at the Loyola New Orleans College of Law. I conducted research on current criminal immigration issues and aided her in a project to be distributed in the state of Louisiana.
positions.title: Research Assistant

positions.companyName: IFEMA : International Trade Fair and Convention Centre
positions.description: Conducted multiple research assignments for IFEMA's 2010 Action Plain, created a comparative study of competition convention centers for national distribution, translated internal and external documents, and compiled a comparative study of European Convention Center competitors for internal business plan use.
positions.title: Trade Fair Management Department Intern			Summer

positions.description: Acted as the head of the Phonathon Recruitment Program, organized open houses and promoted job opportunities, conducted interviews for open positions, coordinated a business incentive program, and trained callers to insure compliance with organization standards.
positions.title: Recruitment Manager, Supervisor

positions.description: Planned the 15th Anniversary Breast Cancer Walk; recruited and organized 250 volunteers, planned and managed promotional events, and managed inventory for promotional tools utilized by over 500 teams.
positions.title: Community Management Intern
